alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 11:14AM CDT until April 15 at 2:48AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Bigbee, Amory...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 20.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
